intro: Actinocephalus brevifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved actinocephalus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers arranged in compact heads. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is typically found in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
